meanings.definition: A unit of money equal to one thousandth of a dollar.
meanings.sent1: I found a few millines in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: She paid for the candy with a couple of millines.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted millines, so I had to find some.
meanings.sent4: In the land of make-believe, millines grew on trees.
meanings.sent5: The shiny millines sparkled under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure equal to one thousandth of an inch.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was so thin, it measured in millines.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler worked with millines to ensure precision.
meanings.sent3: The tailor joked that he needed millines to sew the fairy's dress.
meanings.sent4: The distance between them was as small as millines in a tape measure.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's skill was evident in his use of millines.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure equal to one thousandth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used millines to calculate the tiny distance.
meanings.sent2: The precision instrument measured in millines for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The race was so close, it was won by millines.
meanings.sent4: The gap between the two cliffs was as wide as millines.
meanings.sent5: The architect's design required millines to ensure perfection.
